translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا سینه ات را [به نوری از سوی خود] گشاده نکردیم؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا سينه‌ات را برايت نگشوديم؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا ما سينه تو را فراخ نكرديم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا براى تو سينه‌ات را نگشاده‌ايم؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (ای رسول گرامی) آیا ما تو را (به نعمت حکمت و رسالت) شرح صدر (و بلندی همّت) عطا نکردیم؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا ما سینه تو را نگشودیم (و دلت را از بند غم حیرت رها نساختیم، و تاب تحمّل نابسامانیهای محیط جاهلیّت و سختیهای مسؤولیّت بزرگ نبوّت را به تو عطاء نکردیم؟). [[«أَلَمْ نَشْرَحْ ...»: شرح صدر. کنایه از: سعه صدر، رهائی از غم و اندوه حیرت و ضلال پیش از نبوّت، تاب تحمّل مشکلات مسؤولیّت نبوّت و رهبری، صبر و حوصله در برابر ناملایمات محیط و دردسرهای کفّار و مشرکان و دیگران است (نگا: انعام / 125، زمر / 22، طه / 25، نحل / 106).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آیا دلت را برایت گشاده نداشتیم؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا ما سینه تو را گشاده نساختیم،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا فراخ نگردانیدیم (گشاده نداشتیم) برایت سینه‌ات را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آيا ما سينه تو را برايت گشاده نكرديم؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آیا سینه‌ات را برایت نگشادیم‌؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: HAVE WE NOT opened up your breast

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Did We not widen your bosom?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Did We not expand thy breast for thee

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Have We not opened forth for thee thy breast?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Have We not opened your breast for you (O Muhammad (Peace be upon him))?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Did We not soothe your heart?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: (O Prophet), Did We not lay open your breast

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Have We not opened your breast for you

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Have We not caused thy bosom to dilate,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Did We not open your breast for you

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Have We not expanded your chest for you (Prophet Muhammad),

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Did We not expand for you, [O Muhammad], your breast?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), have We not comforted your heart,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Have We not expanded for you your breast,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Alam nashrah laka sadraka

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Have We not lifted up your heart,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Have We not expanded thee thy breast?-

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و بار گرانت را فرو ننهادیم؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و بار گرانت را از پشتت برنداشتيم؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و بار گرانت را از تو فرو نهاديم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و بار گرانت را از [دوش‌] تو برنداشتيم؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و بار سنگین (گناه) را (به اعطای مقام عصمت) از تو برداشتیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و بار سنگین (تلاش فراوان، برای هدایت مردمان) را از (دوش) تو برنداشتیم؟ [[«وَضَعْنَا»: فرو آوردیم. پائین آوردیم. «وِزْر»: بار سنگین. مراد بار کمرشکن غم و رنج حاصل از مشاهده کفر و شرک و تبهکاریها و خونریزیها و ستمگریها و نابسامانیهای جامعه پیش از نبوّت، و تلاش و کوشش آن حضرت برای هدایت مردمان و دفع اذیّت و آزار ایشان در آغاز نبوّت است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و بارت را [از دوشت‌] برنگرفتیم؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و بار سنگین تو را از تو برنداشتیم؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و نهادیم از تو بارت را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و بار گرانت را از تو فروننهاديم؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و بار گرانت را از دوشت بر نداشتیم‌؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And removed your burden

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And relieve you of the burden –

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and lift from thee thy burden,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And We have taken off from thee thy burthen,

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And removed from you your burden,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And lift from you your burden.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and relieve you of the burden

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And removed from you your burden.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And eased thee of the burden

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and relieve you of your burden

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and relieved you of your burden

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And We removed from you your burden

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: relieved you of the burden

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And taken off from you your burden,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: WawadaAAna AAanka wizraka

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and removed your burden

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And removed from thee thy burden

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: همان بار گرانی که پشتت را شکست.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بارى كه بر پشت تو سنگينى مى‌كرد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: كه پشتت را شكسته بود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [بارى‌] كه [گويى‌] پشت تو را شكست.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: در صورتی که آن بار سنگین ممکن بود پشت تو را گران دارد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: همان بار سنگینی که پشت تو را در هم شکسته بود؟ [[«أَنقَضَ»: سنگینی کرده بود. گرانبار ساخته بود. مَجازاً شکستن پشت معنی می‌دهد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: همان که می‌خواست پشت را بشکند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: همان باری که سخت بر پشت تو سنگینی می‌کرد!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آن را که بشکست پشتت را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آن [بار گرانى‌] كه پشتت را بشكسته بود.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (باری گران) که پشتت را شکسته.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Which had left you devoid of hope,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Which had broken your back?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: the burden that weighed down thy back?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Which weighed down thy back.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Which weighed down your back?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Which weighed down your back?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: that had well-nigh broken your back?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Which weighed down your back

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Which weighed down thy back;

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: which [almost] broke your back?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: that weighed down your back?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Which had weighed upon your back

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: which had been a heavy weight upon your back

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Which pressed heavily upon your back,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Allathee anqada thahraka

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: that weighed so heavily on your back, and

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: The which did gall thy back?-

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و آوازه ات را برایت بلند نکردیم؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا تو را بلندآوازه نساختيم؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و آوازه‌ات را بلند كرديم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و نامت را براى تو بلند گردانيديم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و نام نکوی تو را (به رغم دشمنان، در عالم) بلند کردیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و آوازه‌ی تو را بلند نکردیم و بالا نبردیم؟ [[«ذِکْر»: آوازه. نام نیک. حسن شهرت. آوای گواهی به پیغمبری محمّد، به دنبال گواهی به توحید خداوند، شبانه‌روز دست کم پنج بار بر فراز مناره‌ها و بر بال امواج تلویزیونها و رادیوها در آفاق طنین‌انداز است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و آوازه‌ات را بلند گرداندیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و آوازه تو را بلند ساختیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و بلند ساختیم برایت نامت (یا سخنت) را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و نام و آوازه‌ات را بلند نكرديم؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و نامت را برایت بلند نگردانیدیم‌؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And exalted your fame?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And We have exalted your remembrance for you.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Did We not exalt thy fame?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And We have upraised for thee thy renown.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And raised high your fame?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And raised for you your reputation?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And did We not exalt your fame?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And have We not raised high your fame

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And exalted thy fame?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Did We not exalt your name?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Have We not raised your remembrance?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And raised high for you your repute.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and granted you an exalted reputation?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And exalted for you your esteem?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: WarafaAAna laka thikraka

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: have We not given you high renown?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And raised high the esteem (in which) thou (art held)?

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس بی تردید با دشواری آسانی است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پس، از پى دشوارى آسانى است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس بى‌ترديد با [هر] دشوارى آسانى است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس [بدان كه‌] با دشوارى، آسانى است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس (بدان که به لطف خدا) با هر سختی البته آسانی هست.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: چرا که همراه با سختی و دشواری، آسایش و آسودگی است. [[«فَإِنَّ ...»: بیان علّت و سبب مطالب پیش است. «الْعُسْرِ»: سختی. دشواری (نگا: بقره / 185، طلاق / 7، کهف / 73). «یُسْراً»: آسایش. آسودگی.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بی‌گمان در جنب دشواری، آسانی است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: به یقین با (هر) سختی آسانی است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا با سختی است گشایشی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس، همانا با دشوارى آسانى است.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس به‌راستی با دشواری، آسانی است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Surely with hardship there is ease.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So indeed with hardship is ease.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: So truly with hardship comes ease,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then verily along with every hardship is ease.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So verily, with the hardship, there is relief,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: With hardship comes ease.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Indeed, there is ease with hardship.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Verily, along with every hardship is relief,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: But lo! with hardship goeth ease,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed ease accompanies hardship.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Indeed, hardship is followed by ease,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: For indeed, with hardship [will be] ease.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: After every difficulty there is relief.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Surely with difficulty is ease.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fainna maAAa alAAusri yusran

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: So, surely with every hardship there is ease;

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: So, verily, with every difficulty, there is relief:

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [آری] بی تردید با دشواری آسانی است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: هر آينه از پى دشوارى آسانى است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: [آرى‌] مسلما با [هر] دشوارى آسانى است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آرى، با دشوارى، آسانى است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و با هر سختی البته آسانی هست.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: مسلّماً با سختی و دشواری، آسایش و آسودگی است. [[«إِنَّ مَعَ ...»: تکرار آیه، برای تحکیم مطلب پیشین و تأکید این سنّت خدائی در همه ادوار است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آری در جنب دشواری آسانی است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (آری) مسلّماً با (هر) سختی آسانی است،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا با سختی است گشایشی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: همانا با دشوارى آسانى است.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: به‌درستی با دشواری، آسانی است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: With hardship indeed there is ease.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Indeed with hardship is ease.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: truly with hardship comes ease.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily along with every hardship is ease.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Verily, with the hardship, there is relief (i.e. there is one hardship with two reliefs, so one hardship cannot overcome two reliefs).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: With hardship comes ease.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Most certainly, there is ease with hardship.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Verily, along with every hardship is relief.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! with hardship goeth ease;

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed ease accompanies hardship.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: indeed, hardship is followed by ease!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed, with hardship [will be] ease.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Certainly, after every difficulty there comes relief.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: With difficulty is surely ease.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Inna maAAa alAAusri yusran

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: surely, with every hardship there is ease.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Verily, with every difficulty there is relief.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس هنگامی که [از کار بسیار مهم تبلیغ] فراغت می یابی، به عبادت و دعا بکوش

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: چون از كار فارغ شوى، به عبادت كوش.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس چون فراغت يافتى به [عبادت‌] كوش

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس چون فراغت يافتى، به طاعت دركوش؛

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس چون از نماز و طاعت پرداختی برای دعا همت مصروف دار.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: هرگاه (از کار مهمّی) بپرداختی، به دنبال آن (به کار مهمّ دیگری بپرداز و در آن بکوش و) رنج ببر (و فرجام کاری را آغاز کار دیگری‌کن). [[«فَرَغْتَ»: فراغت یافتی. تمام شدی و بیکار ماندی. «إنصَبْ»: رنج ببر. مؤمن باید انسان متحرّک و پویائی باشد و پس از فراغت از وظیفه‌ای، آماده کوشیدن و سختی کشیدن در وظیفه دیگری باشد. چون: ما زنده به آنیم که آرام نگیریم.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پس چون فراغت یافتی، [در دعا] بکوش‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: پس هنگامی که از کار مهمّی فارغ می‌شوی به مهم دیگری پرداز،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس هر گاه که فراغت یافتی بایست (بکوش)

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس چون [از كار] فارغ شدى به عبادت كوش و رنج آن را بر خود هموار كن.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس چون (از کار رسالتت) فراغت یافتی، (برای خود جایگزینی) نصب کن‌.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So when you are free work diligently,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So when you finish the prayer, strive in supplication.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: So when thou art empty, labour,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then when thou becometh relieved, toil;

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So when you have finished (from your occupation), then stand up for Allah's worship (i.e. stand up for prayer).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: When your work is done, turn to devotion.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: So, whenever you are free, strive in devotion,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So when you have finished, devote yourself to Allah's worship.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: So when thou art relieved, still toil

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So when you are done, appoint,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: So, when you have finished (your prayer), labor (in supplication),

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So when you have finished [your duties], then stand up [for worship].

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: When you are free from (your obligations), strive hard (to worship God)

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So when you are free, nominate.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faitha faraghta fainsab

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: So, when you are free, strive hard,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Therefore, when thou art free (from thine immediate task), still labour hard,

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و مشتاقانه به سوی پروردگارت رو آور.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و به پروردگارت مشتاق شو.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و با اشتياق به سوى پروردگارت روى آور

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و با اشتياق، به سوى پروردگارت روى آور.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و به سوی خدای خود همیشه متوجه و مشتاق باش.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و یکسره به سوی پروردگارت روی آر (و تنها بدو دل و امید ببند، و جز به او خود را مشغول مساز). [[«إرْغَبْ»: رغبت کن. علاقه‌مند شو (نگا: قلم / 32).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و به سوی پروردگارت بگرای‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و به سوی پروردگارت توجّه کن!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و بسوی پروردگار خویش بگرای‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و به سوى پروردگارت روى آر- آهنگ او كن و هر چه خواهى از او بخواه-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و با اشتیاق، سوی پروردگارت روی آر.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And turn to your Lord with all your love.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And incline towards your Lord.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and let thy Lord be thy Quest.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And Unto thine Lord, attend.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And to your Lord (Alone) turn (all your intentions and hopes and) your invocations.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And to your Lord turn for everything.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and turn to your Lord with longing.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And to your Lord turn intentions and hopes.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And strive to please thy Lord.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and supplicate your Lord.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and let your longing be for your Lord (in humility).

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And to your Lord direct [your] longing.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and be devoted to your Lord's service.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And make your Lord your exclusive object.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waila rabbika fairghab

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and to your Lord turn [all] your attention.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And to thy Lord turn (all) thy attention.
